results.title: Meet the chief
results.creator_credit: Swift Films, Boy Scouts Association (Great Britain) and Peter Hadingham
results.brief_description: The Chief Scout, Sir Charles MacLean, in his home on the Isle of Mull. He is shown entertaining three Scouts and showing them over the castle where his ancestors have lived for centuries. The 1960 march past of Queen’s Scouts before Her Majesty at Windsor Castle; the Chief Scout’s speech on that occasion. Finally, a message from him to the Scouts of the Commonwealth.

results.title: Meet the author: Elizabeth Jolley
results.brief_description: Elizabeth Jolley was born in England and migrated to Western Australia in 1959 with her husband and three children. Elizabeth has held many different occupations throughout her lifetime; writing being one of the more passionate ones. Elizabeth, interviewed by Linda Jeffery and Mark Buckeridge discusses her attitude to writing, how characters are created and the mechanics of writing a novel. Aimed at years 10-12. No other production details available.

results.title: Meet me in St. Louis
results.creator_credit: Arthur Freed, United Artists Corporation, Vincente Minnelli and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A captivating musical set in St. Louis at the time of the 1903 World’s Fair. The story tells of a family who are crushed to learn that their father has accepted a transfer to New York City. The five children don’t want to leave their friends, or, most of all, miss the fair. The family upheaval and the final resolution of the story, make an unforgettable, heart-warming movie. Based on the novel by Sally Benson and starring Judy Garland and Margaret O’Brien.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Freed, United Artists Corporation, Vincente Minnelli and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer

results.title: Meet me in Las Vegas
results.creator_credit: Joe Pasternak, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Roy Rowland
results.brief_description: While vacationing in Las Vegas with his mother, a wealthy Nevada rancher meets a ballet dancer who brings him luck at the roulette wheel. Shot on location in the renowned Sands Hotel, the film captures the glitz and glamour of the neon-lit gamblers’ paradise in its martini-era prime and features numerous cameo appearances by famous actors and Las Vegas entertainers including Frank Sinatra, Paul Henreid, Lena Horne, Frankie Laine and Peter Lorre. A song and dance highlight, featuring Cyd Charisse, is the thirteen minute bop parody of the ballad ‘Frankie and Johnny’ with special lyrics by Sammy Cahn sung by Sammy Davis Jr. Other songs include ‘The Gal With The Yaller Shoes’, ‘If You Can’t Dream’, ‘My Lucky Charm’, ‘Hell Hath No Fury’, ‘I Refuse To Rock ‘N Roll’

results.title: Meet John Doe (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Liberty Films and Frank Capra
results.brief_description: In this acclaimed Capra extravaganza, warning against the threat of fascism, Gary Cooper portrays a naive street tramp who becomes the unwitting tool of corrupt politicians. Journalist, Ann Mitchell (Barbara Stanwyck) conveys the story of John Doe, who then becomes the voice of the people and the champion of decency and fair play. Doe threatens suicide as the ultimate protest against corruption; and thousands of good citizens rally to prevent his death. Director Frank Capra weaves touching comedy into this powerful screen masterpiece. Also stars Edward Arnold and Walter Brennan.

results.title: Meet De Sica
results.creator_credit: Christopher Leigh-Smith, Santa Lucia Productions and Bika De Reisner
results.brief_description: An analysis of Vittorio De Sica, as director, actor, man; relaxed and informal, then occupied and businesslike. De Sica himself guides the narrative and introduces interesting sidelights from his intensively creative life. We learn much of De Sica’s ideas and methods from long detailed excerpts of his films, including Bread, Love and Dreams, Shoeshine, Bicycle Thieves, The Bed, Miracle in Milan.
